Following real life story will elucidate that senior citiizens can be motivated, by giving them our love, a purpose, and making them autonomous.
One of my friend’s mom recently retired from her very active job. After her retirement, she lapsed into self-loathing and laziness steadily. My friend became worried about the situation and decided to change it.
He reassured to his mom, that they loved her irrespective of whether she worked or not. He asked his sister to spend more time with her mother. Once she felt reassured of her families love and started to smile, then he started a kind of routine in her life.
Routine was a simple morning ritual, like watering the in-house plants followed with refreshements and reading a page of a motivational book. Followed with mandatory breakfast with family and so on. After a month of such routine, she herself started new projects and got motivated. Now she is fully taking on new challenges for her family.
Have a fun time.

Logic and seeking truth has to be your goal. Philosophy is an activity which has been done by thinkers for a long time. Questioning the world that you live in, and being curious is other way to learn philosophy. I would suggest to begin by reading the “Children's Book of Philosophy”. It introduces the philosophers and their ideas very precisely. Later you can take courses in Edx and Harvard.
Youtube has political Philosophy course which is so good, that you will get engrossed in it at the first go. Arguments they have is very contraversial, so head to that course with open brain. There are philosophers who are anarcho communists and others who are anarcho capitalists. These extremes have to be learnt as the ideal cases, and not to be thought as reality.
Also philosopher can be Idealists, Realists and Pragmatists. These philosophers put on certain ideas / beliefs as their lens and then see the world. Use your own judgement in assimilating what you read.
Many writers, authors, statesmen and officials have their own philosophy which is a variant of ideals. They add their own ideas on the existing philosophy, like Aristotle who disagreed with Plato. You too can do the same, and come up with something creative.
Hope this helps. Share your experience later….

We read so much in this connected world today, just like eating junk food and consuming alcohol. How food takes time to add to your weight so does what you read. The process is as follows.
Read
Remember
Recollects
Use in real world
Feel better
Remember
This is how your brain works to assimilate what you have read. Less you read the better. Due to our fast moving world, we push ourselves to consume more. Slowing down is our first priority in assimilating what we read.

Humans are born with power to reason, was the belief of Plato. In order to find a reason for something, a conscious being has to be creative and hungry. Human survival becomes the biggest reason for many things we do, where no creativity is required.
Once your hunger is satiated, then your reasoning ability starts searching for other reasons to survive. There comes reproduction, dominance, and afterlife. The more you are removed from base reasons and move on to more aesthetic reasons, you start being creative.
In order to be creative, there has to be mind space. You create that by stopping all distractions, like books, movies, and other man made junks. Let the nature give you ideas, that you can put on paper. You might stare at blank paper for hours, and get nothing. Another day, you may not be able to stop writing.
Other way of becoming creative is going on a date with yourself to a new part of a town, and then write about the experience. You will find that, what you saw and what you describe will be sometimes extremely different.
The above two ideas comes from the book, How to think like an artist.
Then you can take a blank paper and start doodling, and learn to draw. Yes, learning to draw can be a one big creative kicker. Because, your brain finds a new way to express itself, and the mind capitulates on this new found skill. That is the reason, why you see people with lot of practice create wonderful creations.
It is a small primer on creativity… I am sure it will take you a long way.

By asking open ended questions and then listening to the speaker. Open ended questions contain, How, Why, When, Where and What. It is that simple, and then be attentive to the speaker.
Being a active listener means, not interupting until you have a question. It is not difficult if you practice regularly. Yeah, when the other person asks a question, you keep your answer short. Once your answer is complete, then end it with a open ended question.
This is natural for kids and youngsters. As you grow up, we want to talk more and ask less (like I am doing now). Changing this habit can be very useful in long run.

Redundancy is the savior of the internet. Internet is really a set of webpages on servers located in multiple data centers around the world. In each country the data specific to that country is stored and a copy is exported to different country. In this way, failure of a data center will not affect the internet. Storage is not a weak point
The transatlantic cables have been also made redundant with satellite connection. So connection is not a weak point.
The equipment like routers and switches are configured and designed with redundancy in mind, so even the equipments are not weak point.
Only way for internet partly to come down is all three affected at same time and kept down for prolonged time. This can happen if the power to multiple data centers are stopped. Which again is made redundant by sourcing power from two different grids, from different country.
There you go, the odds of internet taken down is very low. Say one in a 10000 attempts are required. So rest easy.🙂

Yesterday I had opportunity to visit an excellent car wash in town. So let me take this business as example. They had customers visiting them all day. In the brief two to three hours I stayed there, there were 5 customers who visted, and all did business with them. Assuming that 10 customers visit per working day, then in a month there will be 200 customers.
Next is the revenue each customer brings. Lets assume the average revenue is 700 INR per customer, then per month revenue is 140,000 INR. Lets assume further that the fixed and variable costs per month is 100,000, so the profit per month is 40,000 INR. There is taxes and the interest payable, so the final cash flow would be different from the actual P&L. (The small business buyer will go in detail, and collect all the above information that I have assumed. He will then compare it with other better / worse performing car wash businesses.)Then you extrapolate it to the entire year, including the cycle of revenue increase and reduction, and improvement of over all business year on year
Based on the number of customer visiting, and the fixed and variable costs spent by the car wash also can be extrapolated. After you have calculated YOY revenue, the cash flow can be calculated and extrapolated. To do this, it is better to get hold of P&L, Balance sheet and Cash flow statements from the auditor of that small business.
Once you have the cash flow for each future year, you can run the NPV (net present value) calculation and add all the NPV. The NPV depends on the Cost of the capital (Interest rate) for you and the Return rate you are expecting. Most business expect 12% returns to begin with.
That is how you arrive at the cost that you can pay for the small business. There are countless books, and blogs out there explaining the same with myriad examples and more in detail. Here I have provided an outline.

Companies and Organisations are made of people who come together to make a profit. Companies are nothing but a set of solutions. It is in the benefit of these companies that their employees are entrepreneurial. Let me explain.
Being entrepreneurial means, doing the ground work about the customer they are targeting and their problems. Then the solution that companies can provide is matched with the problems the customers have. More customers like the solution, they spread the word. The company flourishes, and the entrepreneur learns and develops his skill set too.
Each GM, Senior Manager and Manager in an organisation is outward focused to learn from the customer, while the engineers and solution providers focus inwards to fit together the best solutions. I had explained elsewhere, how the companies are like fishing nets, and the customers are the fishes. Only difference, these nets service/ solve the customers’ problems and troubles. Then let them pass to become customers for other companies. This is the abundance mindset. Everyone wins. The Nets and Fishes.
The companies themselves are bigger fishes, which are being served or eaten by the government policy nets. Recent governments have realized the benefits of serving the companies and letting them be there in the ocean. So the countries, their government flourishes. Everyone wins. Abundance mindset.
So there you go, Enterpreneurial employees make a huge difference for a company, country and his own life.

I want to answer what success feels like in Business first..
When it comes to business it is like catching fish. You can catch fish using fishing rod or by using a fishing net. When you are a free lancer, you are using a fishing rod and catching fishes at leisure. When your are part of a team which wants the same fish and ready to share their effort, then you use the net.
More you become good at handling your team and manage the net, better is your fish capture quantity. The net is made of the factory workers, RnD, quality and logistics team. More they cooperate under your guidance, better the success is.
Steady turnover and revenue generation will bring more profit. Which is invested in new nets, that is factories and teams. More people get jobs and more fishes can be captured.
Oh yeah, the fish here is the customer. Think about how successful you will feel when you captured your first fish with fishing rod. Then multiply it by 1000 times.
To answer your question, the feeling of failure is antithetical to business. Because there are customer with problems always. All the business does is turn around and solve a different problem and capture the market. Failed business becomes a phenomenal stepping stone. There is a feeling of elation when failure comes your way…
Customers are the key… Simple

Answer the question, Why you want to reach the Goal?
That answer itself will lead you to the answer for, How to plan and reach your goal?
Say, you want to take your mom to temple. We all know how to do that, right. Still, you ask the question, Why you want to take your mom to temple? Your answer is, to get her blessings in front of god, then you will have additional steps to be taken before you take her to temple. Do you get the idea??
Why is first and foremost… ask and answer that.

I have faced this challenge, and it is very frustrating.
To recall something pleasant, you have to be in a pleasant mood. The more you try to make the mood pleasant, it becomes worse, is it not? The secret is not trying to make it pleasant. Just accept as it is.
It is tough but why to be frustrated more when you are already feeling unpleasant. One important tactic is to share the situation with your loved ones, so you can get a perspective, and feel light at heart. Other way is to look at the impact this situation is going to have on your life after a week, a month, a year.
All these and more are shared in Book of Joy. An excellent book on how to lead a happy life and change your perspective.

I am sorry for the frustration that you are feeling.
Let me share you my story. I have been a toastmaster (Toastmasters is place where you learn public speaking, and gain confidence) for almost two years, and in that I had opportunity to lead a project. My story is exactly about such frustrations when you lead a project.
My project was to increase the number of meeting attendees from 8 members to 16 members. I had very less members to support me, and those who were experienced, were occupied in their own projects. Only new members volunteerend work with me.
I tried to increase the reach of our club through various means. The team who were under me, were trying their best. The outcome was not positive immediately. Many mistakes were happening. There were delay, people falling sick, the world impacted by Covid. All these were happening.
All of a sudden, after an year of working together, I could feel a magic. The team was working in perfect sync. Everyone was doing their activity to the point, and our club reached 16 members after 9 months since I started my project.
It is not that people are wrong or right . It is about awakening their inner passion for the job. Every one wants to feel worthy, and they want to contribute. Some do it immediately. Others take long time. Patience and learning is more important when working under a team.

Meditate.
We all want to do a lot of things, in reality giving ourselves and our mind time can take us a long way. Meditating is really Non-Doing. It is being aware that you are not doing anything, and being in the present.
The more we give time to meditate, the better our mind can concentrate on tasks that we later do. Another important benefit is one tends to listen actively to the environment. Another is the reaction time slows down. Another is our health improves… Hold on, there are so many other benefits of Non-Doing. Did you ever imagine???
Try it. Meditate, next time when you are free. Vipassana Meditation
and Full Catastrophic living can give you some ideas on how to start.

Great question, I myself have done a lot of recording and editing. Not in Garageband, but in Camtasia. These two softwares are similar.
To record your voice, it is better to have a good microphone. There are countless option available ranging from 800 INR to 15,000 INR. Regular 4K camera that comes with laptop is much better in quality, so external camera is not necessary.
There are editing softwares that comes with regular OSes, of which Garageband is very sophisticated. Once you open Garageband application, there will be new project. Under which, you can create new recording. Once record the clip, the video and audio data gets populated automatically in the software. Then you can start editing.
Editing is very similar to how you edit any word file. It takes bit of understanding the icons, and their features. Once you go through the basic tutorials, then you are all set. A very easy, and usable software. Try it out.

I take the affirmative in this argument and state that, 10K hours practice rule really works. There are countless examples that can be sighted as proof for this fact. As all the argument goes, if you can find one example that fails, the argument can be proved to be wrong.
To prove this fact wrong, the best way is to disprove it yourself. You can be the example that did not meet the criteria. Take one new hobby, say to type on keyboard using only left hand, and do it for 10K hours. (You can do that Dvorak Layout in just under 5 hours, I typed this answer only with my right hand while I was drinking hot cup of tea with the other) Still, you can take this challenge, and say that you did not master such left handed typing, and show that this argument is disproved.
10K hours is more of psychological pressure that your mind gives into while learning anything new. There are many analogies that can be stated here, but I don’t want to corrupt this argument with analogies or metaphors.

When you do 100 things to grow, then it is growth mindset. When you realise that your growth will come from 20% of those 100 things you did, that is pareto principle.
Pareto principle can be applied to everything in life. In growth mindset it is very useful. Because, when you are struggling to grow there are lots of things you do. After growing, you see the result and wonder why I did all those useless things. At that moment remember the Pareto principle.. ;)

During the lockdown, there were series of insecurities that cropped up. First was the insecurity about the job, then about my relationship position, about my friends, then the world view that I was holding.
Insecurity arises when your belief and the reality don’t match. You might think that you are strong, and handsome. Your close friend might like you, and want to spend all her time with you. In your brain, you might still think that friend is not liking you and leave you. This is one of the many examples that I can think off.
Insecurity arises with the thoughts, so training your thoughts to be positive, attractive and filled with love giving energy is important. It takes training in prayer and affirmations to convert the thoughts to be filled with positive energy. I believe that the world is made of love and kindness. World is made for us to be happy and live long. With these beliefs, the insecurities can be managed with sustained training.
I had learnt this through Book Of Joy written by Dalai Lama and Archbishop. It is a wonderful gift those two men have given to us. Read it, and am sure you will find clarity and calmness.

Actions speak more about someone than their words.
To read someone’s mind is to observe them. Holistically.
Everything they decide shows what they are thinking, and in turn can help you to read their mind. Choices they make can be influenced by their friends, which in turn tells you what kind of friends they have. That in turn tells you what they think.
You are innately good at reading people’s mind. Only, you have to believe in that skill. Take time to still your own mind, so you can think about others and not about your own anxieties and fears. Expertise here is improving your calmness in order to live a more fulfilling life.
Hope this helps

Your girlfriend is your friend first. If she had been with another guy due to infatuation, and she told you about it then it means she is still loyal to you. Yes, you heard me right.
Guys see loyalty only at physical level. Girls see loyalty at Emotional level. If she shares you something very intimate, something that can potentially endanger her relationship, she has been loyal to you. In fact girls expect the guys to be emotionally mature in such cases. Because, adultery is not a new concept to this world. So get over it.
On the contrary. She had hid the information, and you found it yourself. Then, you are going to be the one who is going to confront her. Talk to her as openly as possible, and invite her to discuss the lapse. Girl might feel offended, when a boyfriend interferes in her personal life. Just assure her that, you are straightening out things by discussing. Girls too have temptations and desires, it is understandable.
If her emotional loyalty is at stake after the discussion, then it is better to be good friends with her. Be clear on this point, and respectfully distance yourself. No messages. No arguments. Most of all, don’t talk financial settlements. Be a man…
Most importantly talk to your close friend (female friend would be helpful) about such a thing has happened. Share your sadness. Cry a river, if required. Give yourself a week or a month to griev the loss and get over it.
You deserve someone better, and that better person is “You” first. Remember.

Everyone time and again feel jealous. This is how our animal brain has been wired. Once you accept that, then you can find a solution for that.
Solution begins with changing your mindset on how you see others and yourself. First and foremost, wishing happiness and joy to those you love, recognising that, they too are human like you and very well enjoy the pleasure they are having, finally every thinking about a time when you too had such a pleasure can effectively reduce the sting of jealousy.
Seems simple to say, you might counter. I tried this and failed many times. The secret is training your mind to counter the jealous thoughts. Mindset has to be changed along with the way you are thinking.
Reading Book of Joy, helped me a lot. The lessons on the 8 pillars of joy showed unique way of finding happiness within oneself was game changing. Hope I was helpful.

Not a difficult challenge. I am going to be helpful only because you are going to make the guy fall in love with you and keep him happy… pls don't dump him after he falls for you.
Guys think girls are very stable and have lot of confidence.Use this to your advantage. Love yourself and groom yourself very well. Think of yourself as the princess. This is your starting point.
Be on and off: All you have to do is be attentive to him one or two days and then ignore him for 3 days. Wait on his every word for one hour and then don't give any sign of attraction towards him.
Be visual: Next use your eyes to convey what you want and see him like how you will see a cute child who is trying to get something from you. When you use your eyes, be aware of your own reactions towards him. How you feel is more important.
Be unpredictable: Fight with him on petty issues, like saying you don't like the color of his shirt, the way he eats or talks. Jus for the fun of it, make him do things. Then ignore him.
Be Kind: Fourth and finally listen actively to him. Listening to someone is basic kindness. Means, after he says something listen and tell in your words what he said. This when used correctly will become very seductive.
Being seductive is a forgotten art form that every girl had to learn. You have taken the first step. Way to go.

Start with your belief.
Do you believe that every thought you think is yours, or is it placed by someone / thing else? If you are confident that your thoughts are generated by your own mind, then the interests you have are also, genuinely yours.
Seldom, our thoughts are our own. Even the mind that we have, is not entirely inside our brain. Brain only is a sense organ which can sense your and our mind.
The interest that you are talking about, does it resonate with you? When you do that activity, do you feel excited, or energetic. Like, I love reading novels, and talking philosophy, so on. Well, how do you feel? If that you are interested makes you love yourself, then you are genuinely interested.
Question that would arise next is, What is meant by loving oneself? In a way, love is to show attention to details, even to very simple and silly things.
There you go, hope I have convincingly answered your query.

Lets assume that you are really living your life, that is you are using time constructively. Then the question would become, What can you do as a developer to use your life more productively?
There you have the first point that needs your attention. The thinking of most developers, and engineers are locked in the blaming mode. Not everything happens to you is because, you chose an option. Life unlike programming logic, has lots of other causal relations. The moment you see life as something that is to live, and enjoy then you see the options to do exactly that. Change the perspectives of your thoughts.
See if you can answer the question, “What I value from the bottom of my heart?” If what you answer is what you are doing, then in fact you are living your life to the fullest. If you don’t get a clear answer, then let your attention to stay on that question and see what answer surfaces up. This activity has to be done everyday, and see where it takes you.
Even though I am mechanical engineer by training and sales manager by profession, I know the value of Developing a software. You have a unique skill, which can be used in many ways. Spending time with creative softwares, sci-fi books, mathematical ideas, trying projects that you wanted to do as a child now that you have more power and experience. You will be fascinated with how much happiness it brings.
Finally, try teaching the unique skills that you have learnt through your developing experience. Look at the various problems you faced, and how did you solve them in your early work life. How are you solving them now? How will you solve them in future? Think temporally, and start writing out the ideas. Who knows, where it will take and who it would help.
